oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A lower bound for the shortest path problem
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MULMULEY, K
SHAH, P
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We show that the shortest path problem cannot be solved in o(log n) time on an unbounded fan-in PRAM without bit operations using poly(n) processors, even when the bit-lengths of the weights on the edges are restricted to be of size O(log(3) n). This shows that the matrix-based repeated squaring algorithm for the shortest path problem is optimal in the unbounded fan-in PRAM model without bit operations. (C) 2001 Academic Press.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: JOURNAL OF COMPUTER AND SYSTEM SCIENCES,63(2)253-267
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: 15th Annual IEEE Conference on Computational Complexity,FLORENCE, ITALY,JUL 04-07, 2000
